modules.description: Provides functions for serializing and deserializing structured data into a custom binary format, including packing integers, strings, and nested records. Operates on OCaml's native data types such as int, string, and variant types, with support for recursive structures. Used to generate compact binary representations for network transmission and persistent storage.

provides tools for integrating bibliographic references into structured text, enabling the association of citations with specific paragraphs and the management of block-level content. Key data types include references, paragraphs, and blocks, with operations for linking and organizing these elements. Users can create citation-aware documents and manage complex formatting rules within defined sections. This supports the construction of academic or technical texts with precise reference handling.
